title: U.S. Olympic & Paralympic Committee Postpones Athlete Event
summary: The four-day Team USA Media Summit was set to begin Sunday in Los Angeles and feature more than 115 athletes. The U.S. Olympic & Paralympic Committee indefinitely postponed a multi-day media event set to start next week in Los Angeles and feature more than 115 athletes as the coronavirus outbreak continued its global spread.

title: Coronavirus Cases in New York Rise to 142
summary: Eight of state's confirmed cases hospitalized; Cuomo calls Westchester County a national hot spot. ALBANY, N.Y.-The number of novel coronavirus cases in New York state rose to 142 on Monday, and included a high-ranking government official who oversees airports in the New York City area and an emergency medical technician who works in Brooklyn, officials said.

title: The Markets Are Awful, But at Least They Work-for Now
summary: Selloff has triggered stress in financial plumbing, but measures of market disruption suggest this hasn't yet become anything like 2008. You know things are bad when the good news in markets is that the financial system seems to be working well enough that people can dump their stocks in a reasonably orderly way.

title: Criminals Cash In on Coronavirus
summary: Hospitals from Italy to Japan have reported disappearing inventories of newly precious masks and hand sanitizer. As coronavirus sparks a global run on medical supplies, criminals are moving in.

title: Coronavirus Cases in New York State Rise to 105
summary: Gov. Andrew Cuomo urges the CDC to approve testing for Covid-19 by private labs. The number of people across New York infected with coronavirus was 105, based on state and city tallies Sunday, as residents prepared for a new workweek full of caution about personal contact and staying home if they notice any concerning symptoms.

title: Now Comes the Oil Shock
summary: Putin shows again he's not Trump's friend. What about MBS?. President Trump has defended Saudi leader Mohammed bin Salman despite his displays of bad judgment or worse. If the crown prince wants to return the favor, now would be the time amid the panic in oil markets after a price war broke out between former cartel partners Russia and Saudi Arabia. How about putting in a call, Mr. President?

title: EU, Turkey Discuss Migration and How to Improve Frayed Ties
summary: Tensions between Brussels and Ankara have soared in recent days, with both sides seeming to misjudge the other's mood. BRUSSELS-Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan and top European Union officials began discussions Monday on how to shore up a migration deal from 2016 and stabilize their deteriorating relationship, but there was little narrowing of differences.

title: FedEx CFO Alan Graf to Retire; Treasurer Mike Lenz Named Successor
summary: Graf, 66 years old, will serve as finance chief until Sept. 22 and then help in Lenz's transition through the end of the year. FedEx Corp. said Chief Financial Officer Alan Graf Jr. is retiring Dec. 31, and Mike Lenz, the delivery giant's corporate vice president and treasurer, will take over the role.

title: Sharing Your Digital Health Data: New Rules Ease Access
summary: Consumers might be able to organize all their health visit and insurer data on their smartphones, but will face privacy questions. Sharing your personal health data with apps, doctors and hospitals will get easier under new federal rules, announced Monday, that are likely to sharpen a debate over patient privacy.

title: International Criminal Disgrace
summary: Only at the ICC could the Taliban and U.S. be treated as equals.. Americans who believe in international institutions often lament that their countrymen don't appreciate the value of global cooperation. They'd have more credibility with more Americans if they called out anti-American outfits like the International Criminal Court.

title: The Fed's Market Emollients
summary: The central bank has liquidity tools to ease financial conditions.. A decade of relative market calm may have caused some folks to forget that financial panics happen, and that's one reason the Federal Reserve exists. Amid the coronavirus contagion and now an oil price shock (see nearby), the Fed may need to break out its 2008 medical kit to supply liquidity to fainting financial markets.

title: Coronavirus Hurts Broadway Box Office
summary: Disney's 'Lion King,' 'Frozen' and 'Aladdin' post lower weekly sales; stage-door access is curbed. As the coronavirus continues to spread, some Broadway shows are taking a hit at the box office.

title: Canada Vows Response to Crude-Oil Blow
summary: Energy is Canada's biggest export, and Saudi-fueled plunge adds to woes for economy struggling with coronavirus impact. Canadian officials vowed Monday to do whatever it takes to support its resource-reliant economy in the face of a crushing blow from sharply lower energy prices, which threaten to further roil an economy already under pressure from the coronavirus epidemic.

title: Energy Stocks Suffer as Oil Prices Crash
summary: Feud between oil giants Saudi Arabia and Russia threatens to flood market with a glut of crude. Energy stocks in the S&P 500 fell to their lowest levels in 15 years, dragged down by a feud between oil giants Saudi Arabia and Russia that threatens to flood the market with a glut of crude.

title: A Car Key Can Save You From the Virus
summary: Germaphobes of the world, unite! But don't shake hands or stand too close.. My late father, a kindly internist with a deep Southern drawl and the improbable name of Dr. Tom Fite Paine, guided my 1950s and '60s childhood with polite rules intended to counteract the spread of contagious illnesses. Thanks to his regard for the cunning of infectious diseases, I grew up wary of unchecked sneezing, office martyrs running a fever, and doorknobs. As we all should be.

title: Bank Stocks Plunge Along With Oil
summary: Recent rate cut and pessimistic outlook for global growth due to coronavirus foreshadow tough times for lenders. Shares of global and U.S. banks plummeted Monday after a collapse in oil prices sparked fears that financial institutions, already struggling with falling interest rates, could be in for trouble.

title: Japan Stands for Free Trade
summary: Protectionism leads to poverty. Technology and trade promote growth.. Protectionism has swept the world in the past decade, but one major economic power is bucking the trend: Japan. The Shinzo Abe government has championed the Trans-Pacific Partnership (TPP), the Japan-European Union Economic Partnership Agreement and the Japan-U.S. Trade Agreement. These agreements established free-trade areas over more than 60% of the world economy. Japan is currently negotiating the Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership with China, India and 13 Asia-Pacific countries.

title: 'The Power Notebooks' Review: Finding Strength in Weakness
summary: A writer who tends to object to all signs of victimhood reveals the tender underbelly of her thoughts about sex, power and being a woman.. When Katie Roiphe was 15, she had what she called a "relationship" with a 30-something rabbi. She had been enthralled by this alluring man with caramel eyes, yet she cried when he first kissed her and was sickened by what he called making love, even as she enjoyed some of it. Like Alice when she bites that first cake in Wonderland, Ms. Roiphe was startled by the abrupt "violence of growing up." Yet years later, when she first wrote about this affair in a magazine article, she was quick to claim that she had wielded real power in the exchange and that the exploitation went both ways. When she told the story at parties, she writes in "The Power Notebooks," she polished it into a tidy coming-of-age tale about her precocity and rush to grow up.

title: Trump and the Pandemic
summary: The virus can't be bluffed or bullied and will soon become his greatest adversary.. The coronavirus pandemic is the greatest challenge Donald Trump has ever faced. As stock markets fall and patient numbers rise, the epidemic threatens the lives of some Americans and the prosperity of all-and it has already begun to disrupt the political methods that brought Mr. Trump to the White House.

title: And Now a Word for Laissez-Faire
summary: Calling critics 'market fundamentalists' is meant to squash debate, not foster it.. Laissez-faire has become a dirty word. Today it serves as shorthand for a soulless, anything-goes approach to life in which government makes no contribution to a thriving economy and the market is the solution to every problem.

title: As Virus Spreads, Italy Locks Down Country
summary: Only essential travel to, from and within all of country is allowed; virtually all public gatherings are banned. MILAN-Italy placed its entire national territory under quarantine, only two days after it locked down much of the country's north, marking the most dramatic step by any country so far to contain the coronavirus epidemic.

title: CFPB Says Fifth Third Employees Opened Accounts Without Consent
summary: Lawsuit alleges bank didn't do enough to monitor or adjust sales goals. The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau said Monday that Fifth Third Bancorp employees opened deposit and credit-card accounts without customer approval in a bid to meet ambitious sales goals.

title: Small Businesses Hurt by Coronavirus Offered Loans and Grants
summary: New York City companies report decline in business as disease spreads. New York City is offering interest-free loans and cash grants to small businesses that see a significant decline in sales due to the coronavirus outbreak.

title: Virus Clouds China's Prospects to Meet U.S. Trade Commitments
summary: The coronavirus's spread has hurt Chinese economic demand and trade. WASHINGTON-The spread of the coronavirus and related economic uncertainty is threatening to undermine the "phase one" trade agreement that the Trump administration signed with its Chinese counterparts less than two months ago.

title: Led Zeppelin Is Cleared in 'Stairway to Heaven' Case
summary: Appeals court says British rock group didn't steal the open from an obscure single by the band Spirit. Led Zeppelin didn't steal the opening bars of "Stairway to Heaven," a federal appeals court ruled in a decision that music executives hope will slow claims that some of the most popular songs are rip-offs.

title: Afghanistan's Presidential Rivals Hold Parallel Inaugurations
summary: The political fissure comes one day before the Afghan government is supposed to launch U.S.-backed peace talks with the Taliban. President Ashraf Ghani and his main political rival held dual inaugurations on Monday as they both sought to claim rights to lead Afghanistan, despite intense U.S. intervention aimed at averting the rift.

title: Columbia Students Lounge, Pack Bags With Classes Cancelled
summary: Thousands of New York City-area students couldn't attend class in person as the coronavirus spurred temporary closures. Columbia University students sprawled on blankets on campus lawns, played Spikeball and tossed Frisbees in the warm sun Monday after the sudden cancellation of classes due to concerns about coronavirus.

title: If Only All the Candidates Could Drop Out
summary: The Democratic primary race will eventually be over, but already it seems to have gone on forever.. Surely the one thing we can all agree on about the Democratic presidential primary is that it has gone on much too long. I have no notion if the Founding Fathers intended so extended a contest, but I can guarantee that if they had to put up with one of such length, they would have been bored out of their wigs. The only relief has been comic, supplied by that always reliable gaffemeister Joe Biden, who at the end of a lengthy interview with Chris Wallace said, "Thank you, Chuck."

title: Notable & Quotable: Hillary
summary: 'What's one way to get them diverted from the ways that Trump is making in handling the coronavirus? Well, let's bring up Hillary's emails again.'. From a CNN interview with Hillary Clinton March 8:

title: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Proposes Whistleblower Award Program
summary: Proposal is part of three measures that the agency said would further its strategy to prevent consumer harm. The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau proposed a whistleblower program that would award tipsters who voluntarily provide original information on possible violations of consumer financial laws.

title: Turmoil Cascades Through Currencies
summary: Volatility in forex markets jumps as investors flee commodity-linked currencies. Foreign-exchange markets convulsed, as steep drops in oil and stock prices sparked a flight from commodity-linked currencies into the perceived safety of the yen and Swiss franc.

title: Ethiopia Blames Design, Training Problems in Boeing 737 MAX Crash
summary: Authorities say flight-control system was vulnerable to misfire and prone to issue confusing warnings. Faulty aircraft design and inadequate pilot-training recommendations from the manufacturer led to the fatal crash of a Boeing Co. 737 MAX jet after takeoff from Addis Ababa in Ethiopia a year ago, according to an accident report issued by Ethiopian investigators.

title: Fed's Crisis-Era Playbook Could Guide Response
summary: The central bank takes initial step to keep short-term funding markets operating by boosting the size of short-term lending operations. A global market rout could force the Federal Reserve to update its 2008 crisis playbook to prevent sharp market dislocations from turning any economic shock from efforts to contain the novel coronavirus into a full-blown recession.

title: Trainers Accused of Racehorse Doping Scheme
summary: More than two dozen industry professionals were charged, including trainer of Maximum Security. Federal prosecutors charged more than two dozen racehorse-industry professionals Monday in an alleged doping scheme that they said included Jason Servis, the trainer of Maximum Security, among the best racehorses in the world.

title: Aon to Acquire Willis Towers Watson in Deal Valued at $30 Billion
summary: Deal to acquire Willis Towers Watson comes as global markets convulse over spread of coronavirus, oil turmoil. Aon PLC agreed Monday to acquire rival Willis Towers Watson PLC for almost $30 billion in stock, the biggest global M&A deal of the year announced on one of the wildest days for markets in recent memory.

title: It's Time to Face Up to 'Feedback Fatigue'
summary: Companies have questions for customers. Sometimes, too many.. Kimberly Purcell describes herself as a huge Costco fan, but her latest purchase came with something she didn't want.

title: Fear Gauge Jumps to Highest Level Since Financial Crisis
summary: Spreading coronavirus and falling oil prices push VIX to highest intraday level since 2008. Investors are gearing up for a prolonged period of volatility after two of the most punishing weeks for U.S. stocks in recent memory.

title: Bear Markets Arrive in Some U.S. Sectors and European Indexes
summary: The S&P 500's financial, industrial, materials and IT sectors enter bear-market territory. A broad swath of U.S. stock-market sectors entered a bear market, defined as a 20% drop from a recent high, after major European indexes suffered a similar fate.

title: Coronavirus Symptoms Start About Five Days After Infection, New Research Finds
summary: Incubation period supports recommendations of a two-week quarantine, according to a Johns Hopkins University study. Most people who catch Covid-19-the disease caused by the novel coronavirus-start showing symptoms roughly five days after infection, disease analysts at Johns Hopkins University said on Monday, in the largest such study of known cases world-wide.

title: 'Traditional Techniques' by Stephen Malkmus Review: An Established Indie Rocker Still Explores New Ground
summary: Stephen Malkmus continues his experimental phase, now venturing into the realm of acoustic folk music..

title: Blackstone to Buy Majority Stake in Software Company HealthEdge
summary: Deal values HealthEdge at around $700 million, including debt, a person familiar with the matter says. Blackstone Group Inc. is buying a majority stake in a health-care software company-the latest example of its strategy to invest in fast-growing firms.

title: Twitter Pays Up to Buy Dorsey Time
summary: A buyback helps the company keep its part-time CEO, but the clock is ticking. Twitter found the price of keeping its part-time CEO: $2 billion.

title: Twitter, Elliott Strike Truce Leaving CEO Dorsey in Place
summary: Agreement calls for Twitter to appoint two new board members, search for a new independent director, and make $2 billion in share repurchases. Twitter Inc. and activist hedge fund Elliott Management Corp. have agreed to a truce that will shake up the social-media company's board but leave Chief Executive Jack Dorsey in place.

title: Free Fall in Oil Sinks Stocks Closer to a Bear Market
summary: Blue-chip index falls 2,000 points, S&P slides as investors push U.S. Treasury yields to fresh lows. U.S. stocks careened lower Monday, with major indexes swinging perilously close to the first bear market in more than a decade as a price war for oil and fallout from the coronavirus frightened investors.

title: U.S. Shale Drillers Could Be Casualties of Oil-Price War
summary: Standoff between Russia, Saudi Arabia over oil production cuts threatens to devastate U.S. frackers, who have little ability to withstand lower prices. U.S. shale drillers are poised to be among the biggest losers in the oil-price war stoked by Russia and Saudi Arabia that has sent global prices crashing.

title: European Soccer's Kings of Winning One-Nil
summary: No one is better at defending a 1-0 lead than Atlético Madrid. Now they just have to do it against Liverpool.. In the biggest match of its season, Atlético Madrid took no shots on goal for over an hour. The side was pinned back so far that it completed barely two-thirds of its passes and let its opponent have twice as much of the ball. When that opponent is Liverpool, the defending champion of Europe and runaway leader of the Premier League, that's about as smart as boxing with a blindfold.

title: Fingerhut Catalog Owner Bluestem Brands Files for Bankruptcy
summary: Catalog-based retailer has a stalking-horse bid from lenders led by Cerberus. Bluestem Brands Inc., which for decades has been selling everything from apparel to appliances through its Fingerhut catalogs, filed for bankruptcy Monday with a deal to sell its business to Cerberus Capital Management's lending arm.

title: Investors Rush Into Bonds to Shelter From Market Storm
summary: Yields on government bonds tumble to record lows while corporate debt suffers its worst selloff in years. Turmoil in financial markets triggered by an oil price war and the outbreak of the coronavirus sent government bond yields to historic lows Monday, as investors sought safety in the least-risky assets they could find.

title: Swine Fever Was Supposed to Boost Cattle Prices. Then the Coronavirus Hit.
summary: Traders expect consumers to stay home, which has driven cattle prices lower. It was supposed to be a big year for U.S. cattle stockyards, but the coronavirus epidemic is calling into question forecasts for rising beef demand around the world.

title: Cheaper Oil Ratchets Up Pressure on Energy Sector
summary: Saudi-Russia price war increases chances BP, Exxon and other oil giants will curtail spending, including buybacks.

title: An Aging Italy Has World's Highest Daily Deaths From Virus
summary: Coronavirus has killed 5% of known cases, even higher in the worst-affected region, versus a global average of 3.5%. ROME-The coronavirus has killed more people in Italy than in China over the past week. Doctors are warning that a shortage of beds to treat the severely ill could push the Italian death toll higher still.

title: UAW Investigates Allegations of Sex Harassment Against Board Member
summary: United Auto Workers has tapped outside lawyer to pursue inquiry into claims of two female union staffers. The United Auto Workers has hired an outside lawyer to investigate allegations that a member of the union's executive board sexually harassed female staffers under his supervision, according to people familiar with the inquiry.

title: Justice Department Wins Changes to Aluminum Merger
summary: Ruling against Novelis, Aleris comes in first-ever arbitration proceeding used by antitrust enforcers to challenge a deal. WASHINGTON-Justice Department antitrust enforcers prevailed in forcing changes to a proposed merger in the aluminum industry after making an unprecedented decision to litigate the case in front of an arbitrator instead of before a federal court.

title: Oil Prices Collapse After Saudi Pledge to Boost Output
summary: U.S. crude prices slid 25% to their lowest levels since 2016, after Saudi Arabian oil giant Aramco slashed prices and promised to increase output. Oil prices recorded their biggest one-day crash since the first Gulf War in 1991 on Monday, tumbling as traders bet that a clash between oil giants Saudi Arabia and Russia could flood a world already hobbled by the coronavirus outbreak with a glut of crude.

title: Coronavirus, Market Woes Damp Hopes of IT Hiring Comeback
summary: But supply-and-demand imbalance will likely protect tech workforce from the full impact of a downturn. A rebound in information-technology hiring earlier this year might be short lived, as market turmoil is making employers brace for the impact of the coronavirus outbreak on the global economy, recruiters and industry analysts say.

title: Coronavirus Opens Economic Front in Presidential Campaign Battle
summary: Uncertainty created by the virus has given Democrats a fresh opening to question the president. Facing low unemployment rates and a rising stock market, Democrats have struggled to make the case that President Trump's economy is leaving too many Americans behind.

title: Mexico Grinds to a Halt as Women Strike to Protest Gender Violence
summary: Many stores and schools were closed during the strike Monday, a major victory for women protesting a wave of violence. MEXICO CITY-Hundreds of thousands of women paralyzed Mexico in an unprecedented nationwide strike to protest a rising wave of violence against women, a major victory for their cause in a country known for its machismo.

title: Trump Shifts Oversight of Some Arms Exports, Easing Sales
summary: Congress will no longer be notified when the U.S. approves overseas sales of certain weapons. The Trump administration on Monday initiated a change in the way that U.S. manufacturers will be allowed to export some firearms, ammunition, and gun components, relaxing federal requirements for such transfers.

title: Split Verdict for CIA Programmer Charged in Massive Leak
summary: Jury finds Joshua Schulte guilty of false statements and contempt of court but deadlocks on whether he actually gave information to WikiLeaks. A federal jury couldn't reach a verdict on whether a former software engineer for the Central Intelligence Agency was responsible for leaking a trove of classified documents to WikiLeaks, convicting him instead on lesser charges stemming from the leak.

title: 'Your Life Is a Record' by Brandy Clark Review: Familiar Fare Made Fresh
summary: Her new album traces the before, during and after of a breakup in a sonically surprising fashion..

title: Montana's Democratic Governor Dives Into Senate Race
summary: Bullock was re-elected as governor in 2016, when President Trump handily won the traditionally red state. Montana's two-term Democratic Gov. Steve Bullock said he would challenge incumbent Republican Sen. Steve Daines, putting the GOP on defense in another state as it fights to keep control of the Senate in November.

title: Wells Fargo Chairman Resigns
summary: Board member James Quigley also quits, ahead of Congressional hearing this week. Elizabeth Duke has resigned as chairman of Wells Fargo & Co.'s board of directors, days ahead of a congressional hearing during which she was expected to face calls to step down.

title: Streamer Quibi Faces Patent Infringement Claim Over Video Feature
summary: Interactive video company Eko says Quibi's highly touted 'Turnstyle' feature makes unauthorized use of its intellectual property; Quibi denies the allegation and files suit. Short-form streaming video service Quibi, which is preparing to launch next month, is facing claims that one of its core technology features infringes on another company's intellectual property, according to documents that describe the dispute.

title: Abortion and Access if Complications Arise
summary: The American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists supports robust, evidence-based, factual discourse.. Regarding Christina Francis's "The OB-GYNs Who Play Politics With Women's Lives" (op-ed, March 4): The American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists supports robust, evidence-based, factual discourse. In the service of advancing public health, we provide courts, policy makers, our 60,000 obstetrician-gynecologists members, patients and news outlets with accurate, evidence-based, consensus-driven information on obstetrical and gynecological issues.

title: Two Americans Die in Raid on Islamic State Hideout in Iraq
summary: Deaths come as U.S. security cooperation with Baghdad continues despite rift. BEIRUT-Two American soldiers were killed during a raid on an Islamic State hideout in the mountains of central Iraq, highlighting the continuing security partnership between Baghdad and Washington despite strained relations.

title: CFTC Is Right, Elections Are No Commodity
summary: Because there would be no specific physical or financial asset underlying a political "future," it would fall outside the Commodity Exchange Act, the authorizing legislation.. Max Raskin's view that the "CFTC should let you make money off our next president" by allowing financial contracts on election results reflects a fanciful view of futures markets extending from ubiquitous computer trading and marketing of public participation as an "alternative asset class," of which neither is usually motivated by existing price risk or knowledge of the instrument ("Why Won't the CFTC Let You Take a Position on the Election?," op-ed, Feb. 29). In other words, many participants don't know exactly what or why they're trading. Since U.S. exchanges are free markets open to all, of course these speculators can participate for whatever reason.

title: Democrats' Israel Problem Goes Way Beyond Sanders
summary: Sadly, today's Democratic Party vis-à-vis Israel is almost unrecognizable as the party of Henry "Scoop" Jackson, Ed Koch or even Bill Clinton.. Regarding William McGurn's "The Democrats' Israel Problem" (Main Street, March 3): It can be persuasively argued that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's late surge in the polls and comeback victory can be attributed in part to Bernie Sanders and his anti-Israel cohort. Israelis doubtlessly saw endless video of Mr. Sanders and the Democratic field spew their hostility at Mr. Netanyahu ("racist") and the American Israel Public Affairs Committee ("bigoted") or the other candidates' ambivalence toward Sen. Sanders's positions.

title: Spicy Pucker Is a Real Flavor, and It's Everywhere
summary: Makers of snacks and drinks are increasingly combining hot pepper flavors with sour ones to throw a new kind of punch at consumers' eager palates. Lovers of all things spicy, prepare to pucker up.

title: How Far Should Americans Go to Stop Coronavirus?
summary: Locking down economies can also be unhealthy.. A time traveller from the 1970s would be surprised to arrive at this moment in 2020 and learn that many Americans were anxious rather than elated to see plunging oil prices and interest rates. Trying to explain that investors were selling U.S. stocks because a foreign cartel of oil-producing dictatorships couldn't agree to withhold supply would only add to the confusion. And one would probably not even bother trying to discuss credit concerns arising from the risk that there might just be too much domestic energy production in the United States.

title: You CAN Clean Your iPhone With Disinfecting Wipes
summary: After years of telling us not to use Clorox wipes and other cleaning products on our phones, Apple finally admits that some disinfectants are fine. Turns out, we've been living an iPhone-cleaning lie.

title: How the Federal Reserve Can Ease the Coronavirus Panic
summary: Rate cuts won't do much good, but the bank can calm panicky markets and avoid recession by supplying liquidity.. The spread of the new coronavirus has already wreaked economic havoc. China's economy virtually came to a standstill in February. Elsewhere, tourist and business travel has collapsed, conferences and sporting events are being canceled, and supply chains for the production of goods have been hit. These demand and supply-side shocks-and the expectation of more to come-have led to panic in the financial markets. In the past two weeks, equity markets have fallen steeply and volatility has soared, the 10-year U.S. Treasury yield has collapsed to an all-time low, and liquidity in the market for U.S. government securities-normally the world's most liquid market-has dried up.

title: Michigan Democrats Will Offer General Election Clues
summary: Sanders, Biden hope to win Midwest industrial state Tuesday and retake it from the president in November. President Trump's team has been weighing the prospects of a race against a populist outsider or a party stalwart. Michigan's Democratic primary may determine just what they get.

title: Head of N.Y. Port Authority Tests Positive for Coronavirus
summary: New York surpasses Washington state for the most confirmed infections in the country. ALBANY, N.Y.-The executive director of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey has tested positive for the novel coronavirus, as the state of New York surpassed Washington state with the most cases in the country, New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo said.

title: Global Fear of Flying Spawns Crisis for Airlines
summary: As bookings fall sharply, carriers are cutting flights, grounding planes and trimming costs.. The coronavirus has suddenly and unexpectedly created the biggest challenge for the global airline industry since 9/11.

title: Virtu Signaling Pays Off in a Crisis
summary: Investors are hurting as stock prices plunge, but shares of financial middlemen are a rare bright spot. Across a sea of red numbers on financial investors' screens on Monday morning, one flash of green stood out: Virtu Financial .

title: Big Oil's Big Dividends Are Under Threat
summary: Major oil companies will struggle to cope if crude remains at $35 a barrel, though Saudi Arabia will feel the pressure as well. The only thing major oil companies can do amid plunging prices for their key commodity is to make spending cuts. If the oil price stays around $35 a barrel, even their dividends may not be spared.

title: America's Hottest New Dating Sites: Business School Campuses
summary: A growing proportion of women in M.B.A. programs has yielded greater gender parity in classes-and more business-school weddings. Liza Merolla and her husband, Justin Merolla, are among a growing number of couples who met through one of the world's most expensive dating sites.

title: The Race to Replace the Binary of Men's and Women's Sports
summary: Are two athletic categories inadequate? Some researchers think the future lies in creating more, while others propose changing competition rules so that everyone can play against each other. Author

title: Spring Brings a Race to Reshape Athlete Endorsement Rules
summary: Key moments are coming in the states, Washington and the courts in March and April that could define how college athletes are compensated. Legal proceedings in San Francisco fired the starting gun in a crowded race to reshape college sports this year, in which courts jostle with the National Collegiate Athletic Association, federal lawmakers and states over who gets to redefine the rules governing college athletes and their ability to earn money.

title: Offshore Oil Sector Slammed By Price Plunge, Coronavirus Fears
summary: Shares of world's biggest rig builders crash as new price war sends prices plummeting. Share prices in the embattled offshore oil sector crashed Monday as oil prices tumbled, making offshore drilling unviable for an industry already dealing with sluggish demand and lower-cost competition.

title: One of Aspen's Largest Homes Sells for $22 Million
summary: The buyer, who purchased the 16,726 square feet property for less than half its original asking price, threw in her Florida home to sweeten the deal. One of the largest homes in the ritzy mountain town of Aspen, Colo., has sold in an unusual transaction for $22 million.

title: Halting the No. 2 Economy Was Easy. Restarting It Is Hard.
summary: China's health emergency is starting to ease, but its economic maladies look to be long-lasting. Weeks after an epidemic froze much of China's economy, activity has begun to pick up, as businesses restart operations and consumers venture out again. But the road back to normal is likely to be long.

title: Coronavirus Crisis Alters Political, Economic Conventional Wisdom
summary: Outbreak alters thinking about national-security threats, central-bank powers, dependence on China. As the severity of the coronavirus outbreak was becoming clear, Republican Sen. Josh Hawley of Missouri sent a letter to the Food and Drug Administration arguing that the crisis was revealing a dangerous dependence on China in one key area.

title: Stock-Buyback Plans Shrink
summary: The new coronavirus may threaten companies' buyback plans-though a down market could also create a buying opportunity.

title: Mexican Inflation Picked Up Pace in February
summary: CPI rose 0.42% from January amid higher prices of fresh produce. MEXICO CITY-Mexican inflation accelerated in February from the previous month as higher prices of fresh produce offset a decline in energy costs.

title: Market Rout Deepens Misery for Europe's Banks
summary: Lenders are pledging special measures to customers whose businesses are creaking amid the coronavirus outbreak and market turmoil. Monday's market convulsions heaped more pressure on Europe's limping lenders, as they scramble to help customers cope with the impact of the coronavirus.

title: New Intelligence on How the Female Brain Works
summary: Lisa Mosconi, author of 'The XX Brain,' breaks down new discoveries science is making about the ways women can optimize cognitive health. Lisa Mosconi, a neuroscientist and director of the Women's Brain Initiative at Weill Cornell Medical College in New York City, focuses her research on what she says is one of the most under-researched, underdiagnosed and underrated fields in medicine: the female brain and women's brain health.

title: New York Fed Repo Totals $112.93 Billion
summary: All repos outstanding rise to $202.9 billion; Fed increases amount of very short-term loans it has been offering to money markets. Wall Street's biggest banks took advantage Monday of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York's willingness to offer more temporary liquidity to the financial system amid deeply unsettled markets conditions.

title: Sudan's Prime Minister Survives Apparent Assassination Attempt
summary: Abdalla Hamdok's convoy was hit in downtown Khartoum, rattling the transitional government that has been trying to steady the east African nation. Sudan's prime minister survived an apparent assassination attempt after his convoy came under attack in the capital Khartoum on Monday, rattling the transitional government that has been trying to steady the east African nation after months of protests ousted long-time ruler Omar al-Bashir.

title: XPO to Acquire U.K. Logistics Business
summary: Deal includes drinks logistics, food services and retail and technology businesses from Kuehne + Nagel's U.K. contract logistics portfolio. XPO Logistics Inc. is buying a major part of Kuehne + Nagel International AG's contract logistics business in the U.K., the companies said Monday.

title: Golf's PGA Tour Gets Big Boost in TV, Streaming Rights
summary: Nine-year deal with Comcast, ViacomCBS and Disney amounts to more than $700 million annually, up from current $400 million. The PGA Tour is getting a 75% pay bump for the rights to air its golf tournaments on television and streaming services, people familiar with the matter said, a sizable increase that shows the growing value of live sports to traditional and digital media platforms.

title: This Is Officially Not the 1970s: Bring On Fiscal Policy
summary: Impact of coronavirus, oil-price drop and companies' demand for cash all point to tax relief and government spending. The stars certainly haven't aligned to give policy makers an easy ride: On top of the economic impact of the coronavirus, there is now the likelihood of a sharp drop in investment by the energy sector. They may have aligned, though, to put fiscal policy center stage for the first time since the 1960s.

title: Why Wellness Guru Amanda Chantal Bacon Still Drinks Her Sex Dust
summary: "I sneak this tonic in, which is Sex Dust, Spirit Dust, Brain Dust, Collagen Protect, hot water and some cacao that actually fits in with the intermittent fasting rules.". Amanda Chantal Bacon, 36, opened the first location of Moon Juice in Venice, California in 2011. Originally a pressed-juice bar with adaptogenic dusts (supplements made from herbs and mushrooms), Bacon's company now includes a skin care line and cookbook. Its range of supplements with names like Beauty Dust, Dream Dust and Sex Dust are now also sold at Sephora ($38 for 1.5 ounces). The founder herself went viral in 2015 after her food diary full of esoteric ingredients and hard-to-pronounce health foods was published by Elle. ("I chase [my chi drink] with three quinton shots for mineralization and two Lypo-Sphericl Vitamin B Complex packets for energy.")

title: Health Agencies Tackle Coronavirus With Dwindling Resources
summary: After years of budget cuts, experts say the system is ill-prepared to deal with a fast-spreading disease. Local public-health agencies around the country are facing coronavirus outbreaks after years of shrinking budgets and expanding responsibilities.

title: Ahead of Critical Michigan Primary, Democrats Look to Governor for Winning Formula
summary: Party hopes Gretchen Whitmer's approach could help it win back the state in 2020. Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer's pragmatic, can-do appeal to a diverse electorate helped propel her to the governor's mansion. Some Democrats including Joe Biden, whom Ms. Whitmer recently endorsed, hope the same formula can help them win back the state in the presidential election.

title: The Art of the Unreasonable Trade Deal
summary: Chinese private-sector firms, out trillions of yuan thanks to the coronavirus, are in no position to massively ramp up imports. Under siege from the novel coronavirus, China's economy is poised to contract in the first quarter and post sharply lower growth this year. Under siege from the Trump administration in 2019, Beijing had already agreed to boost purchases of U.S. goods by nearly $80 billion in 2020 over 2017 levels.

title: How to Keep Calm as Coronavirus Fears Turn Into Market Panic
summary: World's financial system is less fragile today than it was during the financial crisis, which should help limit the consequences of the extreme market moves under way. Markets are usually driven by greed or fear. On mercifully rare occasions, they are driven by outright panic. Monday's price movements as Asian markets opened were one such occasion.

title: Census to Kick Off This Week
summary: Much of data collection will happen online for the first time.

title: How America Has Changed Since the Last Census
summary: In the past decade, the country has become more diverse and older. In the 10 years since the last census, the U.S. has added 19 million people, growing more than 6%. The middle of the country has become more diverse, the booming growth of cities has slowed and longer lives and slowing births have resulted in an America that is older than it was a decade ago, according to Census Bureau estimates.

title: Baseball Bat Maker Marucci to Be Sold for $200 Million to Compass Diversified
summary: Marucci is a leading provider of bats for major-league players. Compass Diversified Holdings has struck a deal to buy a leading maker of baseball bats for professional players in one of the few acquisitions to be struck during the market turmoil surrounding the coronavirus outbreak.

title: Health Officials Block Several Princess Cruises Ships
summary: The Grand Princess will dock in Oakland on Monday; its passengers will be quarantined. U.S. health officials warned Americans to avoid cruise trips and blocked several Princess Cruises ships from leaving or docking in an effort to contain any further spread of coronavirus, which has already hit two of the line's voyages.

title: Bracing for Sea Rise, Miami Beach Fights Tide of Angry Residents
summary: Resume Subscription. MIAMI BEACH, Fla.-Tensions are coming to a head as this South Florida city prepares for new infrastructure projects designed to fortify the low-lying island against increased flooding and sea-level rise.

title: Starbucks Tests a Greener Cup
summary: Paper cup features liner made out of biodegradable materials, rather than plastic. Starbucks Corp. is testing a more environmentally friendly coffee cup. It hopes customers won't notice.

title: U.S. Chip Industry Fears Long-Term Damage From China Trade Fight
summary: Silicon Valley warns that sales restrictions threaten to cede its market dominance to rivals. The U.S. semiconductor industry is pressing to get out of the firing line between the U.S. and China, warning its position as the global market leader could become a casualty of the trade spat.

title: U.K. Retailer Tesco to Sell Asia Business to Thai Tycoon
summary: CP Group will buy operator of some 2,000 stores in Thailand and 74 in Malaysia. U.K. retailer Tesco PLC, cutting debt and narrowing its focus, agreed to sell its Asia assets to Thailand's richest family in a deal that values the business at $10.58 billion.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: OPEC, R.I.P.
summary: Sunday's spectacular oil-price collapse marks the effective end of the cartel's power and a devastating setback for the U.S. shale patch. Turning 60 this year and suffering from pre-existing conditions, a once-feared oil cartel is on its deathbed. The shock of a coronavirus-induced collapse in demand may be what pushes it into irrelevance, but the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries was already living on borrowed time.

title: North Korea Fires Projectiles
summary: Pyongyang conducts its second weapons test in a week. SEOUL-North Korea launched three short-range projectiles off its east coast on Monday, Seoul's military said, in Pyongyang's second weapons test in a week after a period of inactivity.

title: 20 Years Later: Lessons From the Dot-Com Bust
summary: Twenty years ago, the Nasdaq Composite hit a then-record above 5000, the internet-stock peak. Are investors any smarter now?. It is perhaps fitting that the stock market plunged last month as we approached the 20th anniversary of the top of the internet-stock bubble.

title: February Was No Great Leap for Stock Funds
summary: U.S.-stock funds fell an average 8.4% in February, as the coronavirus concerns hit late in the month. But U.S. stocks are up modestly so far in March-despite all the daily tumult.. Thanks to the market's coronavirus jolt toward the end of the month, February was brutal for stock-fund investors. March has started out more positively, even though it might not feel that way: Stocks are up modestly for the month so far, after the Dow's two 1,000-point-plus rallies were mostly wiped out by subsequent declines.

title: Robo Advisers Keep Adding On Services
summary: Investors can now get a broader range of products from robo advisers, including cash accounts and retirement services. When the first robo advisers were launched, the idea was to offer everyone access to investing. The slick apps offered ready-made portfolios with minimum investments and account fees as low as $1 a month, appealing initially to younger investors.

title: The Difference Between Investing in an NBA Team and in a Startup
summary: The Boston Celtics' Wyc Grousbeck, who has done both, offers his perspective. Investor Wyc Grousbeck knows about investing in traditional startups as a venture capitalist. And he knows about investing in a professional sports team. And he knows there's a big difference between the two.

title: Emerging Markets Lose Money, Get More
summary: A net $41 billion has flowed into emerging-markets equities funds in the two years through December 2019, coinciding with a period of significant underperformance. When an asset class underperforms over a long period, individual investors tend to flee.

title: The Pros and Cons of Dividend-Reinvestment Plans in a No-Commission World
summary: Some financial pros say DRIPs have lost their luster. Many investors, however, still like the circular experience of dividend reinvesting.. In the brave new world of commission-free online stock trading, many investment professionals say company-sponsored dividend-reinvestment plans, or DRIPs, have outlived their usefulness.

title: Is It Worth Investing in Unprofitable Companies? We Ran the Numbers
summary: Investing in unprofitable companies is risky-but you might not be fully aware of the types of risk you are taking on. Uber , Pinterest , Peloton , Lyft , Snap -the list of unprofitable companies trading on U.S. exchanges is a long one.

title: Publicly Traded Water Utilities Draw Investors
summary: Stocks of publicly traded water utilities are drawing investors who are searching for sustainable investments. Water is hot.

title: ETF Closures Continue at Brisk Pace
summary: Niche products in such categories as obesity and organics can fail to attract assets. The first two months of 2020 saw a record number of exchange-traded funds close-a reflection of the flurry of new ETFs that have tried to attract investors in recent years, many of them unsuccessfully.

title: Central Banks Have Lost Firepower, Kaufman Says
summary: Recent rate cut won't address a crisis, former Salomon Brothers economist says. Economist Henry Kaufman earned the sobriquet of "Dr. Doom" for his gloomy but accurate forecasts of rising interest rates in the late '70s and early '80s.

title: What Is Quad 4?
summary: When inflation and GDP growth are slowing, the U.S. economy is in Quad 4, according to Hedgeye Risk Management. There is a term flying around Wall Street that should scare anyone with money in the market.

title: Two ESG Funds With a European Approach
summary: IQ Candriam ESG US Equity and IQ Candriam ESG International Equity take a proactive approach to socially responsible investing, which could lead to some surprises for investors. Two new exchange-traded funds bring investors low-cost exposure to "do good" stocks-with a European twist.

title: A Nasdaq 'Covered Call' ETF Grows
summary: Assets in Global X Nasdaq 100 Covered Call have almost tripled since the start of 2019, as more investors look to hedge their bets. An exchange-traded fund that uses an options strategy to generate income has recently had a surge of investor interest.

title: Credit Suisse Returns to European ETFs
summary: The three new ETFs, which promise low-cost, convenient exposure to U.S. and international stocks, will be converted from existing index funds. Credit Suisse is getting back into European ETFs.

title: Ted Cruz Isolates Himself After Potential Coronavirus Exposure
summary: Senator says he isn't experiencing symptoms and his move is 'out of an abundance of caution'. WASHINGTON-Republican Sen. Ted Cruz said that he would remain at home in Texas this week in a self-imposed quarantine "out of an abundance of caution" after learning he had last month shaken hands and briefly conversed with an individual who tested positive for the disease caused by the novel coronavirus.

title: How Tupperware Lost Its Grip on America's Kitchens
summary: Ubiquitous brand fights for its future as its direct sales force dwindles and competition rises; 'People don't have time to gather'.

title: Europe's Old Money Mingles With Tech Startups
summary: Family-owned industrial firms that have thrived for generations are now fighting digital disruption. BERLIN-Old-money families in Europe are seeking new-technology investments as they look to bolster their financial returns and, increasingly, remake their companies.
